why the answer is not option D

questions.question_text:
Joe, a user, cannot read encrypted email messages on a corporate smartphone, but he has been able to read them in the past. A technician restarts Joe's smartphone, but the issue remains. The technician deletes the corporate email account and has Joe re-add it, verifying all settings are correct. Despite these steps, the issue persists.
Which of the following is MOST likely causing the issue?

discussion.content: It is impossible to reinstall an application only using windows control panel FYI

Seems like this question is referring to obj 3.1/3.2
A. You can uninstall using windows control panel but can't reinstall
B. same as above
C. Can replace missing or corrupt files while preserving host settings (correct IMO)
D. Silly.
Repair Application
Windows apps can become corrupt for a variety of reasons, including disk errors, poor coding, errant updates, or apps left open when Windows is shut down or restarted. To get a faulty application working again, repair the application.

You can repair an application through Control Panel’s Programs and Features applet. To start the process, click the application, then click Uninstall/Change. If a repair option is available, select it to repair the app. If an app lacks a repair option, uninstall the app and reinstall it instead. - Mike Meyers' ebook

You’ll experience this sort of scenario with error messages such as “missing DLL” or “cannot open file xyz.” The easiest fix is to first try to "reinstall the program", and check for any special instructions about versions of support files. Barring that, the usual second step for either issue is to perform an Internet search for the missing DLL or file that fails to open, along with the name of the program you’re trying to use.
-Mike Meyers ebook
Maybe try B and reinstall the app first?

comments.content: the answer is B if your still wondering

discussion.content: Is it talking about DLL files?
Why not D?

comments.content: Libraries are not external files for an exe. They are files containing coded functions to be used in software development. When a developer compiles an exe, the code from all used libraries is copied into the exe.

choices.D: Locate the missing data library and copy it to the Windows program folder.
choices.B: Reinstall the application using the Windows Control Panel
choices.C: Repair the application using the Windows Control Panel.
choices.A: Uninstall and reinstall the application using the Windows Control Panel.

questions.question_text:
A user reports that an application has been closing unexpectedly for the past two days when posting transactions. When an administrator attempts to access the application, it generates an error stating a data library is missing.
Which of the following should a technician attempt FIRST?

comments.content: It also has the ability to act like Window's System Restore, but with screenshots and date/time stamps for each instance included.

discussion.content: OBJ-1.9: Time Machine is the built-in backup feature of the Mac OS X operating system, and it can be used to automatically back up all of the system's files, including apps, music, photos, email, documents, and system files. Once a user has a valid backup in Time Machine, they can restore files from the backup if the original files are ever corrupted or deleted on their Mac, or if the hard disk (or SSD) is erased or replaced.
Time machine is correct. Anything that deals with System restore in MacOS the answer is always time machine.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct.

questions.question_text:
A Mac user's operating system became corrupted, and files were deleted after malware was downloaded. The user needs to access the data that was previously stored on the MAC.
Which of the following built-in utilities should be used?

choices.C: Applications are causing high resource utilization.
choices.D: Malware is causing excessive data transmission.

discussion.content:
D is MOST likely.
C can be considered however this is a new issue despite usage not changing (and not being a problem in previous months) therefore is less likely than D. Otherwise I agree with Shogo11.
Should be C or D otherwise they need to reword A that he is disconnecting from WIFI unintendedly which is causing more cellular data usage.
B is the answer

I'm leaning towards the answer being D as well. Malware is most definitely a cause for excessive data usage in mobile devices. Check out Professor Messer's video 3.5 Troubleshooting Mobile Device Security.

HE use his moboile before without any issue ... same thing cant be malware as he will spotted that is something wrong cant be aplication he didnt install anything .. so i Will say that A is right .. humble opinion.

Selected Answer: D
Could be C or D, but I would go with D. Malware
Answer is A.

comments.content: oh yes because wifi = mobile data

discussion.content:
Think it's A but it's poorly worded.

C and D both imply something is using more data than normal, but the patterns of data usage haven't changed -- leading A to make more sense due to the user being kicked off of WIFI and having to use their data.

It's just not worded correctly I think.

comments.content:
I think you are correct. "Unintended WIFI DISconnection" would increase data usage NOT "connections" that would have made "A" a good candidate for the answer.
D should be correct

discussion.content: B is the correct answer. Can't be A because if its on WiFi its not using the Data from the mobile provider and if its not using the data it can't reach the cap.

questions.question_text:
Joe, a mobile device user, reached his monthly quota of data about halfway through the current billing cycle. Joe contacts a technician to identify potential issues with the mobile device, as his usage patterns have not changed over the past month.
Which of the following is MOST likely causing this issue?

Which of the following filesystems should the technician utilize to install the listed operating system?

discussion.content:
HFS for Mac
FAT or NTFS for Windows
